Fit Poisson Models and Extract P-Values with Logging

fit_poisson_models.Rd

This function fits Poisson models for each predictor variable against a target variable. It logs the process, including inputs, outputs, transformations, and any variables that are skipped due to insufficient variance.

Usage

fit_poisson_models(data, target_var, predictors)

Arguments

data

A data frame containing the dataset.

target_var

A string representing the name of the target variable.

predictors

A vector of strings representing the names of predictor variables.

Value

A tibble containing the predictor variables, their corresponding p-values, and formatted p-values.

Examples

# Example 1: Basic usage with a dataset and predictor variables
result <- fit_poisson_models(data = my_data_frame, target_var = "outcome", predictors = c("age", "gender", "income"))
#> Error: object 'my_data_frame' not found

# Example 2: Using a larger dataset with many predictors
predictor_vars <- names(my_large_data_frame)[3:20]  # Exclude first two columns
#> Error: object 'my_large_data_frame' not found
result <- fit_poisson_models(data = my_large_data_frame, target_var = "accepts_medicaid", predictors = predictor_vars)
#> Error: object 'my_large_data_frame' not found

# Example 3: Handling a dataset where some predictors may have only one unique value
result <- fit_poisson_models(data = my_data_frame, target_var = "outcome", predictors = c("region", "specialty", "age_group"))
#> Error: object 'my_data_frame' not found
